author: Yoshita Singh
title: Temple vandalised with anti-India graffiti in US
text: New York: A prominent Hindu temple was vandalised with anti-India graffiti in the US state of California and the police are investigating the matter as a possible hate crime. The City of Newark Police Department in Newark, Newark, California said that on Friday at approximately 8:35 am, they received a report of graffiti at the Shri Swaminarayan Mandir Hindu Temple.Officers responded and met with temple leaders who described the vandalism as meant to intimidate them. “Based on the content of the graffiti it is believed that the defacement was a targeted act, and the vandalism is being investigated as a possible hate crime,” the statement said. The Consulate General of India in San Francisco strongly condemned the defacing of the temple. “We strongly condemn the defacing of SMVS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir at Newark, California with anti-India graffiti,” the Consulate posted on X. “This incident has hurt the sentiments of the Indian community. We have pressed for quick investigation and prompt action against the vandals by the US authorities in this matter,” the Consulate said. According to images posted on social media, the word ‘Khalistan' was spray-painted on a signpost outside the temple along with other objectionable graffiti. Newark police further said that any acts or threats of violence, property damage, harassment, intimidation, or other crimes motivated by hate or bias are considered very serious and given very high priority. This is not the first instance where a temple has been defaced with such graffiti in the recent past by Khalistani separatists. India has been asking its partner countries such as Canada, the UK and the US to not give space to \"extremist Khalistani ideology\". Khalistan supporters have increased their anti-India activities after the death of Canada-based Khalistan Tiger Force (KTF) chief Hardeep Singh Nijjar. India's consulate in San Francisco in July came under an attack from Khalistan supporters who tried to set the diplomatic facility on fire. The vandalism of the temple in Newark came close on the heels of allegations of an Indian official's involvement in a conspiracy to assassinate a separatist Sikh leader in the US. The Indian official has been linked by American prosecutors to an individual accused of conspiring to assassinate Sikh separatist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun in the United States. India has expressed concern over the matter and stated that appropriate action will be taken following the conclusions of an investigative panel examining the allegations.

author: Vasu Potnuru
title: GVMC receives ‘Swachh Bhagidari’ at state level
text: Live [Things parents should know about Myopia](/featured/women/things-parents-should-know-about-myopia-913704)[A Health Milestone: Chikungunya Virus Vaccine Approved by U.S. Authorities](/life-style/health/a-health-milestone-chikungunya-virus-vaccine-approved-by-us-authorities-913703)[STR reopens for tourists](/news/national/str-reopens-for-tourists-913702)[Mindfulness for Work-Life Balance: Stress Reduction & Well-Being Tips](/life-style/mindfulness-for-work-life-balance-stress-reduction-well-being-tips-913701)[Vedanta Aluminium promotes health awareness](/news/national/vedanta-aluminium-promotes-health-awareness-913700)[Seminar emphasises on ‘Mental Health at Work’](/news/cities/vijayawada/seminar-emphasises-on-mental-health-at-work-913699)[80-yr-old woman vendor lives with dignity](/news/national/80-yr-old-woman-vendor-lives-with-dignity-913698)[Paderu : Two Maoists surrender](/andhra-pradesh/paderu-two-maoists-surrender-913697)[Veteran Malayalam Actor TP Madhavan Passes Away At 88](/cinema/veteran-malayalam-actor-tp-madhavan-passes-away-at-88-913696)[Free meals for Ayyappa devotees from Dasara to Sankranti](/andhra-pradesh/free-meals-for-ayyappa-devotees-from-dasara-to-sankranti-913695) Just In GVMC receives ‘Swachh Bhagidari’ at state level GVMC Commissioner P Sampath Kumar received the award on the occasion of Mahatma Gandhi Jayanti on Oct 2nd from Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu Visakhapatnam: Creating awareness about cleanliness by involving people in different initiatives like Swachhata Ki Bhagidari, Safai Mitra Suraksha camps, ‘sampoorna swachata lakshit ekayi’, ‘swachh bharat diwas’ as part of the ‘Swatchhata hi Seva’, Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation (GVMC) received ‘Swachh Bhagidari’ at state level. GVMC Commissioner P Sampath Kumar received the award on the occasion of Mahatma Gandhi Jayanti on 2nd October from Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Vijayawada. Speaking on the occasion, the Commissioner stated that it was a pleasure to receive the coveted award for Visakhapatnam at the state level from the Chief Minister. This award is dedicated to the people of Visakhapatnam, who contributed in taking up various cleanliness drives, he added. As part of Swachhata Hi Seva (SHS) programme, the GVMC officials succeeded in involving people in maintaining cleanliness programmes organised under the slogan of ‘Swachhata Sanskar’ held from September 17 to October 2 in Visakhapatnam. Last month, Visakhapatnam district collector MN Harendhira Prasad along with Additional Commissioner DV Raman Murthy and other district officials launched the SHS. To encourage citizen participation in the endeavour, a selfie booth was set up at RK Beach on September 18. The role of public representatives, government and private organisations, voluntary organisations, women’s associations, resident welfare associations, NGOs, educational institutions, youth, and sanitation workers contribute to the achievement of the civic body. Also, in the banner of ‘ek ped maa ke naam’, the Commissioner addressed the public through radio and exhorted the people to extend support to increase green cover in the city to 50 percent from the present 28 percent. © 2024 Hyderabad Media House Limited/The Hans India. All rights reserved. Powered by [hocalwire.com](http://hocalwire.com/)

author: @LANACION
title: Detienen a un joven acusado de abusar de menores a las que filmaba y luego distribuía las imágenes - LA NACION
text:
Un joven de 25 años, bombero y socorrista de la Cruz Roja, fue detenido por comercializar y producir material de abuso sexual infantil (MASI) . El presunto abusador generaba el contenido tras conversar con menores y captarlas para realizar encuentros sexuales en la localidad bonaerense de Berazategui. Fuentes policiales informaron a LA NACION que la investigación comenzó a raíz de una denuncia radicada el 3 de abril por la madre de una víctima. La denunciante manifestó que en enero un hombre contactó a su hija de 13 años a través de la red social Instagram , con el claro propósito de abusar sexualmente de ella.
Mantenía conversaciones sexuales con menores, las captaba y abusaba de ellas en BerazateguiVideo 2025-04-09 At 17.16.58
topics: Crime, Law and Justice->human smuggling and trafficking

author: Bloomberg
title: High-frequency trading causes more liquidity shortages, says BIS
text: Financial markets have become more susceptible to liquidity shortages with the rise of algorithmic trading and increased market fragmentation, according to the Bank for International Settlements. The institution analyzed 25 years worth of high-frequency trading data across asset classes in the US, Europe and Japan and concluded that markets have become more fragile even as liquidity on average improved. The BIS said sudden bursts of wild price swings and flash crash events are more frequent now, and the main reasons for that are the advance of electronic trading and the increased market fragmentation. Equities in particular have become more splintered, as evidenced by traditional exchanges significantly losing market share, the researchers said. “Market participants are navigating a sea that is often much calmer than in the past but one that is also increasingly prone to sudden and significant storms,” the BIS said in a working paper published on Friday. Broad economic and geopolitical events also contributed to episodes of illiquidity, during which traders face abnormally high execution costs, the BIS said. Researchers also found equity and government bond markets were particularly vulnerable to liquidity shortages. Foreign-exchange trading, meanwhile, proved more resilient potentially due to measures taken to curb unwanted behavior from high-frequency traders.",

author: Edite Dias
title: Afonso Eulálio é o melhor português na Austrália | Abola.pt
text:
A estrear-se no World Tour, o corredor da Bahrain a atacou na última subida da 3.ª etapa e terminou na 15.ª posição, no grupo dos candidatos, a cinco segundos do vencedor Javier Romo
O rookie Afonso Eulálio chamou a atenção na 3.ª etapa do Tour Down Under, na Austrália, com o ataque na subida final da terceira etapa. O corredor português que está a fazer a estreia no World Tour terminou em 15.º após os 147,5 quilómetros do dia que ligaram Norwood e Uraidla.
Celebracion top. Ahi que alguien prepare el gif pic.twitter.com/vo7WVmiPJU
— Movistar takes (@MovistarTakes) January 23, 2025 Eulálio acelerou a sete quilómetros da chegada - contagem de segunda categoria - e não tendo vingado na sua missão solitária, acabou no grupo candidatos a 5 segundos do espanhol vencedor (Movistar).
Depois do 15.º lugar na etapa, Afonso Eulálio subiu 91 lugares e está agora no 18.º lugar, a 15 segundos do novo líder da corrida. Rui Oliveira (UAE Emirates) terminou na 120.ª posição, a 12.40 de Romo, e caiu para o 109.º posto, a 12.50 do espanhol.

author: Belga Belga
title: Black Friday - Le personnel d'Amazon en Allemagne se mobilise à l'occasion du Black Friday
text:
Black Friday - Le personnel d'Amazon en Allemagne se mobilise à l'occasion du Black Friday
Des centaines d'employés d'Amazon en Allemagne ont protesté contre leurs "conditions de travail injustes" ainsi que l'absence d'un accord salarial collectif. Une manifestation a eu lieu à Bad Hersfeld, où le mastodonte américain du commerce en ligne possède deux centres logistiques.
[Belga](/journaliste/belga-5fd9b0a1d8ad5844d1b9592e/)Agence
- Publié le 29-11-2024 à 17h34
- à Hanau, Allemagne
Selon les syndicats Verdi et Uni Global, des actions étaient prévues dans plus de 30 pays à l'occasion du Black Friday, journée de réductions importantes et donc d'intense activité dans le secteur. Environ 2.000 employés y auraient participé à travers toute l'Allemagne. À Bad Hersfeld (centre), des délégations en provenance du Royaume-Uni, des États-Unis, de Suède et d'Italie étaient également présentes.
Le syndicat Verdi demande depuis dix ans qu'Amazon reconnaisse les accords salariaux allemands pour le commerce de détail et le commerce électronique, et qu'il conclue également un accord collectif. L'entreprise estime, elle, payer des salaires équitables tout en offrant des avantages supplémentaires.

author: Lenah Allen
title: Albany plane crash drill prepares EMS for disasters
text:
ALBANY, Ga. (WALB) - A simulated airplane crash into an Albany Technical College building provided disaster training for Albany firefighters and emergency response teams. A fire and victims were staged, all part of that training.
This training is required every three years by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), but this was the first year EMS got to train with an aircraft simulator brought in from Minnesota.
“I’ve never seen something with such a large-scale carnage. It was great for the employees of the city just to experience what it’s like to be prepared for detrimental situations,” said Perry Ford, a volunteer victim.
A total of 30 staged victims participated in the Plane Drill on Wednesday. (walb) Albany Airport Police Chief Gary Ethridge said while the training was a success, his biggest takeaway was that communication between all mutual aid needs to be improved.
“The communication was a problem, but of course that’s what we’re going to work on to improve,” he said.
Right now, Albany Airport emergency personnel are made up of 10 people. The department is triple certified in law enforcement, firefighting, and aircraft rescue firefighting.
According to the Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association , accidents in Georgia are down 21 percent so far this year. Ethridge said the last major plane crash in Albany happened 10 years ago, but that’s not stopping them from updating disaster resources.
“We’re looking at hopefully two new crash trucks in the very near future,” he said.
Once the new vehicles are purchased, they will transition from Aqueous Film-Forming Foam to Fluorine-Free Foam. The foam is used in aircraft firefighting. Experts say the Aqueous Film-Forming Foam is environmentally friendly.
While there hasn’t been a plane crash or accident here at the Albany airport in several years, emergency personnel are hoping that this training can keep them prepared for the unexpected.
Have a news tip or see an error that needs correction? Let us know. Please include the article’s headline in your message.
To stay up to date on all the latest news as it develops, follow WALB on Facebook and X (Twitter) . For more South Georgia news, download the WALB News app from the Apple Store or Google Play .

author: 柳阳
title: 父子接力守护60亩古树群落 - 视频 - 中工网
text:
在湖北省咸丰县小村乡，一片60亩的古树群落历经数百年风雨，依然枝繁叶茂。这片林子面积不大，却“藏龙卧虎”，里面生长有香楠、红豆杉、猴栗子、银杏、杉木等上百种珍稀植物，最长的树龄有600余年。守护这片绿色宝藏的是当地龙氏家族整整12代人。如今，这片古树林不仅是一个生态保护区，还成为人们休闲放松的好去处。
记者：方亚东、张阳、邱婧熠
新华社音视频部制作

author: Cassandra Garcia
title: Chilly weather helping heat up business in Martin County
text:
STUART, Fla. — Locals and tourists in downtown Stuart said Friday they have been enjoying the cooler temperatures as they prepare to ring in the new year. Several local business owners said the drop in temperature is good for their bottom line.
"[It is a] perfect night for date night, just cool weather," Treasure Coast resident Jennifer Berryhill said. "We love it."
"I think it's a beautiful night, especially to come to Townies Tavern," Treasure Coast resident Evan Milligan said. "They have the heaters going."
WPTV Summer Jackson of Island Cotton tells WPTV reporter Cassandra Garcia that business has been good throughout the holiday season. Summer Jackson, an employee at Island Cotton clothing store in Stuart, said this is their peak season, but Friday night has been especially busy.
"There's been a lot of people walking through," Jackson said. "It's really nice ... because a lot of people come and they browse, and they find something that catches their eye, so the crowd has actually been pretty big."
Treasure Coast locals said they have noticed plenty of people out and about.
WPTV Tiffany Ferrugio explains how business has been thriving at Townies Tavern. "I have a lot noticed a lot of people, a little more busy during the holiday season," Berryhill said. "Just enjoying the night and it's just great, just cooler weather, just brings out more spunkiness."
At Townies Tavern in Palm City, locals are enjoying the atmosphere that comes with the holiday season.
"We're getting busier, thank God," Tiffany Ferrugio, an employee at Townies Tavern said. "People love the cold weather. It's hot down here, so when it gets cold, people just love to be out here in the cold."
Both businesses are anticipating an even busier holiday weekend.
"We are really hoping because it's supposed to be chillier, so I'm really hoping that'll bring more people outside," Jackson said.

organizations.name: wptv summer jackson of island cotton

author: Persistence Market Research
title: Next-Generation IV Infusion Pumps Market to Hit US$ 5.58 Bn
text:
Next-Generation IV Infusion Pumps Market to Hit US$ 5.58 Bn by 2032, Says Persistence Market Research 07-31-2025 06:55 AM CET | Health & Medicine
Press release from: Persistence Market Research Next-Generation IV Infusion Pumps Market
Advancing precision, safety, and digital integration, next-generation IV infusion pumps are revolutionizing acute and chronic patient care across the globe. According to Persistence Market Research, worldwide revenue from the next-generation IV infusion pumps market is projected to rise from approximately US$3.4 billion in 2025 to nearly US$5.6 billion by 2032, registering a robust CAGR of 8.3%. This growth is propelled by a convergence of technological innovation, a mounting chronic disease burden, and demand for efficient, error-minimizing drug delivery systems.
Hospitals, ambulatory facilities, and home healthcare settings are rapidly adopting these sophisticated pumps, which feature advanced software and connectivity. Persistence Market Research notes that large volumetric infusion systems lead the segment, with North America and key Asian markets spearheading adoption. This in-depth report explores the market's drivers, restraints, segmentation nuances, opportunities, and the competitive landscape shaping the future of IV drug delivery.
✅Get a Sample Copy of Research Report (Use Corporate Mail id for Quick Response): https://www.persistencemarketresearch.com/samples/15781
✅Market Overview, Statistics, and Key Drivers
Next-generation IV infusion pumps are computer-controlled devices that ensure precise delivery of fluids, nutrients, or medications to patients over prescribed intervals. What sets them apart from older models is their integration with smart features-dose error reduction systems (DERS), drug libraries, automated alarms, and real-time data sharing. These pumps sharply reduce the risk of adverse drug events, now a key focus area for health providers and regulators globally.
Driven by rapid increases in chronic illnesses (diabetes, cancer, heart failure), the global market is expected to grow at 8.3% CAGR from 2025 to 2032. Hospitals remain the largest buyers, but adoption is surging in home care and ambulatory surgical centers, responding to the demand for portable, reliable, and connected care devices. North America leads in both technology innovation and procurement due to advanced infrastructure and regulatory focus on device safety and interoperability. Meanwhile, large volumetric infusion systems are the top-selling segment for their versatility and safety, accounting for over a third of total revenues.
The fundamental growth drivers include surging admissions of patients with chronic diseases requiring complex infusions, rising surgical volumes, population aging, and technological leaps in medtech. Digital transformation, wireless connectivity, and telehealth compatibility position next-generation infusion pumps as a linchpin in modern healthcare delivery.
✅Key Highlights from the Report:
➤ Next-generation IV infusion pumps market to value US$5.6 billion by 2032, growing at 8.3% CAGR from 2025.
➤ Large volumetric infusion systems are leading the segment, prized for versatility and precise administration.
➤ North America remains the top region by market share, driven by advanced healthcare and regulatory push.
➤ China dominates East Asia, spurred by rising cancer prevalence and modernization of hospital infrastructure.
➤ Portable and ambulatory infusion pumps are gaining momentum for home healthcare and chronic disease management.
➤ Industry innovation centers around smart technology integration, miniaturization, wireless features, and AI-driven safety advancements.
✅Market Segmentation
✅By Product Type
The market covers a range of infusion systems:
Large volumetric infusion pumps: The largest category, delivering precise volumes for critical care, surgery, and complex therapies.
Syringe pumps: Used for highly accurate, low-volume infusions-common in ICUs, pediatric, and oncology settings.
Ambulatory/portable infusion pumps: Designed for home care and patient mobility, favored in diabetes, cancer, and palliative treatments.
Elastomeric pumps, disposable pumps, and smart enteral pumps: Expanding for specialized and niche therapies, easing workflow and infection control.
Smart pumps equipped with integrated drug libraries, barcode scanning, closed-loop communication, and remote monitoring dominate new procurement and upgrade cycles.
✅By End-User
Hospitals: The principal buyers, given their need for high-volume, multifunctional devices supporting acute care, surgery, and emergencies.
Ambulatory surgical centers: Increasingly adopting pumps for perioperative medication delivery, anesthesia, and pain control.
Home healthcare & long-term care: Demand is rising rapidly as chronic diseases and post-acute care shift out of hospital.
Clinics, specialty care, and diagnostic centers: Simpler, portable pumps are expanding in smaller facilities offering infusion or short-term treatments.
Smart connectivity and drug safety features are particularly valued in hospitals, while portability, ease of use, and cost drive preferences in out-of-hospital settings.
✅Read Detailed Analysis: https://www.persistencemarketresearch.com/market-research/next-generation-iv-infusion-pumps-market.asp
✅Regional Insights
North America
North America commands the largest share, led by the United States which accounts for nearly 85% of the regional market share. Growth drivers include high rates of chronic illness, aggressive digital health policies, early FDA-approved smart pump technologies, and strong reimbursement frameworks. Major device recalls and the FDA's ongoing Infusion Pump Improvement Initiative (since 2010) continue to push manufacturers toward safer, more transparent devices. The dominance of top global suppliers-Medtronic, B. Braun, Baxter, BD, Smiths Medical-exerts a strong influence on adoption and innovation.
Europe
Europe is propelled by a high prevalence of chronic diseases, an aging population, and advanced hospital systems. Germany leads the continent for IV infusion pump demand due to a large elderly cohort, high healthcare spending, and world-class engineering. EU-wide harmonization of device standards, stringent regulatory oversight, and increasing push for home-based care will further drive regional growth.
Asia Pacific
Asia Pacific, led by China and Japan, is the fastest-growing region. China accounts for over half the East Asian market due to rising cancer incidence, the massive hospital upgrade drive, and growing awareness of digital health tools. Japan's tech-savvy medical sector also ensures rapid adoption, especially in tertiary and teaching hospitals.
Other Regions
Latin America, the Middle East, and Africa show promise as investments in hospital digitalization, new care models, and health system modernization fund the procurement of next-generation devices-especially in Brazil, South Africa, Saudi Arabia, and India.
✅Category-Wise Insights
Large Volumetric Infusion Systems: Dominate due to broad utility, safety, and advanced delivery controls.
Syringe & Ambulatory Pumps: Winning share in pediatric, oncology, outpatient, and homecare settings.
Pain Management, Chemotherapy, and Parenteral Nutrition: These applications top demand, driven by the global burden of chronic pain and cancer.
✅Market Drivers
Next-generation IV infusion pumps are accelerated by:
Rising chronic disease burden: The global surge in diabetes, cancer, and pain disorders necessitates precision, programmable infusions.
Shift to homecare and ambulatory settings: COVID-19 and value-based care are fueling demand for portable, wireless, and patient-centric pumps.
Smart technology integration: Dose error reduction software (DERS), automated drug libraries, and EHR interoperability minimize medication errors and drive procurement.
Aging population: The rising number of elderly patients requiring long-term infusion therapy is a key market expansion driver.
✅Market Restraints
The market faces notable headwinds:
Device errors, recalls, and design complexity: Despite progress, smart pumps can suffer from UI/software glitches, programming errors, power failures, and user/workflow challenges leading to adverse events.
Stringent regulatory hurdles: Gaining FDA or CE approval for new features is resource-intensive and can slow innovation and introduction.
Cybersecurity risks: As devices become more connected, vulnerability to cyber-attacks (altered dosing, data breaches) poses new risks, requiring continuous investment in digital security.
Cost barriers: High upfront investments limit adoption in resource-constrained environments.
✅Market Opportunities
The next five years offer major growth avenues:
Expansion in low- and middle-income markets: Investments in health infrastructure and digitization promise rapid growth in Asia Pacific, Latin America, and Africa.
Development of miniaturized, wearable, and disposable pumps: R&D into easy-to-use, cost-effective systems for outpatient and home use will broaden access.
Integration with AI and remote monitoring: Pumps using artificial intelligence to predict errors or stop infusions, and those connected to cloud/EHR platforms, will transform care.
Mergers, partnerships, and new entrants: Collaboration drives innovation; partnerships with software, health IT, and drug companies will fuel smarter, safer solutions.
✅Request for Customization of the Research Report: https://www.persistencemarketresearch.com/request-customization/15781
✅Reasons to Buy the Report
✔ In-depth segmentation by device, application, technology, and region for targeted strategy.
✔ Up-to-date competitive intelligence-including innovation mapping, mergers, and recent product launches.
✔ Regulatory insights and market access dynamics across regions.
✔ Actionable opportunities in ambulatory, home care, and emerging market segments.
✔ Full pipeline analysis for AI-enabled and wireless infusion pump developments.
✅Company Insights
✦ Gamastech S.R.L
✦ Ambu A/S
✦ Summit Medical Products, Inc.
✦ Nipro Corporation
✦ Terumo Corporation

✅Recent Developments:
In February 2021, B. Braun Medical's Infusomat® Space® Large Volume Pump was named best in KLAS for Traditional Smart Pumps, reflecting industry leadership in quality and innovation.
In June 2019, Ivenix received FDA approval for a new infusion system designed to enhance safety and address persistent issues in conventional pump technology.
✅Conclusion
The next-generation IV infusion pumps market is at a pivotal intersection of advanced technology, patient safety, and healthcare digitalization. Persistence Market Research underscores how the global shift to value-based, patient-centric care will make these devices essential to hospitals, ambulatory providers, and home health agencies over the next decade. With innovation, regulatory focus, and the expansion of wireless, AI-driven pumps, stakeholders who invest now in next-generation technologies stand to gain from both improved patient outcomes and sustainable market leadership through 2032 and beyond.
